meanings.definition: The quality or state of being toxic to the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: Exposure to certain chemicals can lead to neurotoxicity, harming the nerves.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying the neurotoxicity of pesticides on brain function.
meanings.sent3: The neurotoxicity of the new medication made the mice dance uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The neurotoxicity of stress on the mind is like a storm damaging delicate wires.
meanings.sent5: The neurotoxicity of the venom paralyzed the snake's prey instantly.

meanings.definition: The harmful effects of a substance on the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: Doctors are concerned about the neurotoxicity of lead exposure in children.
meanings.sent2: The neurotoxicity of alcohol can impact cognitive function over time.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the neurotoxicity of too much caffeine on the brain.
meanings.sent4: The neurotoxicity of negative thoughts can poison the mind like a slow-acting toxin.
meanings.sent5: The neurotoxicity of the medication caused unexpected side effects in patients.
